title: 169-follower problem
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"169 is a "},{"type":"text","text":"square","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" and it is a sum of squares ("},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"169 = 12^2 + 5^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":")."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"But its square can also be written as the sum of two squares. Let
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large 169^2 = a^2 + b^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a > b > 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\gcd(a,b)=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
Without using a calculator, find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a + b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Euclid's formula is a fundamental formula for generating Pythagorean triples given an arbitrary pair of positive integers m and n with m > n. The formula states that the integers
  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"  a = m^2 - n^2 ,\ \, b = 2mn ,\ \, c = m^2 + n^2 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
form a Pythagorean triple. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In our case:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c=169 = 12^2 + 5^2 \Rightarrow m=12, n=5, a=119, b=120, a+b=\boxed{239}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            You need to check that there is no other solution. (In particular, note that you might have possibly picked "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(12 \cdot 12 + 5 \cdot 5)^2 + (12 \cdot 5 - 5 \cdot 12)^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" instead, or you might have used "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"169 = 13^2 + 0^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" instead of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"169 = 12^2 + 5^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"; you should rule those out as well.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We have,
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"169=12^2+5^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Squaring both side yields
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"169^2=(12^2+5^2)^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Or,
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"169^2=(12^2-5^2)^2+4*12^2*5^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
[Because, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a+b)^2=(a-b)^2+4ab"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"]"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Or,
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"169^2=119^2+120^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Since, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4*12^2*5^2=(2*12*5)^2=120^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
[P.S. At first, I deduced "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"169^2=156^2+65^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
which doesn't form a primitive pythagorean triple.]"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 16a+8b+4c+10d+e
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is the smallest possible positive integer value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that for some integers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\beta, "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\gamma,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \epsilon "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the following condition is true?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Condition:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" For every five-digit number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \overline{abcde}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" that is a multiple of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \alpha a + \beta b + \gamma c + \delta d + \epsilon e "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is also a multiple of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Details and assumptions","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \overline{abc}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" means "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 100a + 10b + 1c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", as opposed to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a \times b \times c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". As an explicit example, for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=2, b=3, c=4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{abc} = 234"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and not "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 2 \times 3 \times 4 = 24"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From the given conditions, we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32|10000a+1000b+100c+10d+e"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Subsequently, this means that:
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32|10000a+1000b+100c+10d+e+64e"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=10000a+1000b+100c+10d+65e"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"gcd(32,5)=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we can divide the RHS by 5 to get 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32|2000a+200b+20c+2d+13e"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". It now suffices to show that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the least positive integer value for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Just taking any number where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a,b,c,e"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are even and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is odd will show that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" does not suffice (such as 40256)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus, the smallest positive integer value for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We denote  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{abcde}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"abcde"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textbf{1.}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Consider "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"abcde = 20000 = 32*675"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32 | 2 \alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  and hence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"16 |  \alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha = 16k_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textbf{2.}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Now let us consider "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" abcde = 12000 = 32*375"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".This gives us  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32 | 16k+2\beta"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"16| 2\beta"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8|\beta"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":",
hence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\beta \ge 8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
Clearly "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\beta = 8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is possible since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32 | 10000a+1000b+100c+10d+e"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32 | 10000a+8b+100c+10d+e"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Setting "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha = 1000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \beta = 8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":",  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\gamma"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = 100, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = 10 &  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\epsilon = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":",we have our condition satisfied.
So  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\beta = 8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the smallest possible value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\beta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textbf{3.}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Let us consider abcde = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"24800 = 32*775"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32|2\alpha + 4\beta+8\gamma"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32|32k_1 + 32k_2+8\gamma"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"\
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32|8\gamma"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
 "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4|\gamma"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\gamma \ge 4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\gamma = 4k_3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textbf{4.}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Let us consider "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"abcde = 20320"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32|2\alpha + 3\gamma + 2\delta"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
If 32 divides the whole thing then 4 also does so
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4|32k_1+12k_3+2\delta"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2|\delta"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"hence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta \ge 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now we have to show that the value "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta = 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is achievable."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textbf{5.}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Let us take "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"abcde = 20480"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32|2\alpha+ 4\gamma +8\delta"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If we put "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha = 16k_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\gamma = 4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":",
we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32|32k_1+16+16"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32|32k_1+32"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
This is indeed true !!!So the lowest possible value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is indeed achievable!!!
So The minimum value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10000a+1000b+100c+10d+e is divisible by 32
thus"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"16a+8b+4c+10d+e is divisible by 32."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"now we want to minimize the coefficient of d."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"To do so we multiply the expression by 13"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(16a+8b+4c+10d+e)*13 is divisible by 32 which gives 16a+8b+20c+2d+13e "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"so we get 2"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            coefficient of d would vary depending on the multiplier..
if multiplier is 1 coefficient is 10, if it is 4 then we have 40-32=8, for 7 we have 70-64=6 ..similarly for 13 we have 130-128=2. For 16 we get 0 but we want a positive integer so we go for 13

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I used my calculator to calculate the 10*n mod 32 for n from 1 to 15.
The min is 2 at n=13 :)

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Is there a particular method you decided to use 13 as a multiplier?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            @ Sumit G,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I think you did skip one step, namely explaining why "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" cannot be 1. (Granted, it is a pretty easy step: the fact that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"32|64032"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" shows that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must be even.)

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            @ Jung Min L."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"blockquote","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
  "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Is there a particular method you decided to use 13 as a multiplier?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"
"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can be any "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10x+32y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for integers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x,y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Hence, we can have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta=10(13)+32(-4)=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (or 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\delta=10(-3)+32(1)=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":").

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 16 coins
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/lD8MKtH49d-cartooncoins.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"You play a game where two people take turns picking coins from a pile of coins and the person to take the last coin wins!"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The rule is you can take up to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" coins where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the turn number."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, for example, suppose Sue and Esmerelda are playing the game.  The first person (Sue) can take 1 coin (not much of a choice there!).  The second person to play (Esmerelda) can take 1 or 2 coins.  The third person (Sue again) can take 1, 2 or 3 coins."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose you are the first to move and there are 16 coins."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If both people play optimally, can you guarantee a win? "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Image credit:  https://thecliparts.com"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the turn number, and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the number of coins in the pile, then the following recursive relation determines whether you will win or not ("},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"win, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0 ="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" lose):"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"W(t,c) = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t \geq c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", since you can just take the remaining coins and win"}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"W(t,c) = 1 - MIN(W(t+1,c-i))"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ranges from "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Since you can pick any number of coins from "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so if you play optimally you will pick one where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"W(t+1,c-i) = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Solving, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"W(1,16) = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{\text{yes}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" you can win!"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"You can definitely win if you start first "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1) pick 1 coin on your 1st turn"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2) let your opponent pick 1 or 2 coins"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3) make the total number of coins picked up to 4"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4) your opponent can get the count up to 8"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5) make the count of the coins picked up to 9"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6) your opponent can only get the count upto 15"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7) you win YAY!!!"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: #16 of June 2018 Grade 12 - Natural Sciences CSAT (Korean SAT) Mock test
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/KyHKJuPBqW-1.PNG?width=220"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"As shown on the right, there is a sector "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\rm OAB"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with radius "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and central angle "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{\pi}{2}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\rm H"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the foot of perpendicular from "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\rm P,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" a point on arc "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\rm AB,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{\rm OA}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Pick a point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\rm Q"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" on arc "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\rm BP"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle \rm POH = \angle PHQ = \theta."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then, the area of triangle "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\rm OHQ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S(\theta)."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \lim_{\theta\to 0^{+}}\dfrac{S(\theta)}{\theta}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"It is expected that you solve this in 5 minutes."}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is a part of <Grade 12 CSAT Mock test> series.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{\rm OH} = \cos \theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{\rm OQ} = 1,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" along with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle \rm OHQ = \dfrac{\pi}{2}-\theta."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Use the cosine law to find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{\rm HQ}=x:"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline{\rm OQ}^2 = \overline{\rm OH}^2 + \overline{\rm HQ}^2 - 2\overline{\rm OH}\cdot\overline{\rm HQ}\cdot \cos \left(\dfrac{\pi}{2}-\theta\right) \\
1 = \cos^2\theta + x^2 - 2x \cos \theta \sin \theta \\
x^2 - 2x\cos\theta\sin\theta - \sin^2\theta = 0 \\
x = \cos\theta\sin\theta + \sqrt{\cos^2\theta\sin^2\theta + \sin^2\theta}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then we proceed to find the limit."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\lim_{\theta\to 0^{+}}\dfrac{S(\theta)}{\theta} = \lim_{\theta\to 0^{+}} \dfrac{\dfrac{1}{2}\cos\theta \cdot x \cdot \sin\left(\dfrac{\pi}{2}-\theta\right)}{\theta} \\
=\frac{1}{2}\lim_{\theta\to 0^{+}}\sin\left(\dfrac{\pi}{2}-\theta\right)\cos \theta\cdot\lim_{\theta\to 0^{+}} \frac{\cos\theta\sin\theta+\sin\theta\sqrt{\cos^2\theta+1}}{\theta} \\
=\frac{1}{2}(1+\sqrt{2}) \\
=\boxed{\dfrac{1+\sqrt{2}}{2}}."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: #16 of March 2016 Grade 11 - Liberal Arts CSAT (Korean SAT) Mock test
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For all natural numbers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" a sequence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\{a_n\}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" satisfies:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large \sum_{k=1}^n a_k = \frac{{a_n}^2+1}{2a_n}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Given that all terms of the sequence are positive, find the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{1}{a_{2017}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to five decimal places."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem has been modified by me and is a part of <Grade 11 CSAT Mock test> series.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Define "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \sum_{k=1}^n a_k=S_n."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_1=S_1=k,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k=\dfrac{k^2+1}{2k},"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k^2=1."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since all terms of this sequence are positive, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k=1."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Move around some things in the given formula, we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{a_n}^2-2a_nS_n+1=0."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then we can see that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_n=S_n\pm \sqrt{{S_n}^2-1}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"It's natural that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S_n\ge1,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and thus "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S_n\ge\sqrt{{S_n}^2-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{{S_n}^2-1}\ge0."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"But we know that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" cannot be bigger than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S_n,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_n=S_n-\sqrt{{S_n}^2-1}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S_{n+1}=S_n+a_{n+1},"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so plug in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_{n+1}=S_{n+1}-\sqrt{{S_{n+1}}^2-1}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S_{n+1}=S_n+S_{n+1}-\sqrt{{S_{n+1}}^2-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S_n=\sqrt{{S_{n+1}}^2-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{S_{n+1}}^2={S_n}^2+1,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and we see that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{S_n}^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is an arithmetic progression."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{S_n}^2=n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\therefore~S_n=\sqrt{n}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"It is easy to see that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_n=S_n-S_{n-1}=\sqrt{n}-\sqrt{n-1}~(n\ge2)."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This also holds for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=1,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_1=\sqrt{1}-\sqrt{1-1}=1."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{a_n=\sqrt{n}-\sqrt{n-1}}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The value we're trying to get, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{1}{a_{2017}}=\dfrac{1}{\sqrt{2017}-\sqrt{2016}}=\sqrt{2017}+\sqrt{2016}=89.8109117870\cdots \approx\boxed{89.81091}."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle S_n = \sum_{k=1}^n a_k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". The first few "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S_n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" indicate that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S_n = \sqrt n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Assuming the claim is true, then we have:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} S_n & = \sqrt n \\ \frac {a_n^2 + 1}{2a_n} & = \sqrt n \\ a_n^2 + 1 & = 2 \sqrt n a_n \\ a_n^2 - 2 \sqrt n a_n & = - 1 \\ a_n^2 - 2 \sqrt n a_n + {\color{#3D99F6}n} & = {\color{#3D99F6}n} - 1 \\ \left(a_n - \sqrt n\right)^2 & = n - 1 \\ \implies a_n & = \sqrt n - \sqrt{n - 1} & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{We note that }a_n < \sqrt n \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let us prove the claim that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_n = \sqrt n - \sqrt{n - 1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is true for all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n\ge 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" by induction."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Proof:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} S_1 & = a_1 \\ \frac {a_1^2 + 1}{2a_1} & = a_1 \\ a_1^2 + 1 & = 2a_1^2 \\ a_1^2 & = 1 \\ \implies a_1 & = 1 & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{Since }a_n > 0 \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\implies a_1 = \sqrt 1 - \sqrt{1-1} = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", therefore the claim is true for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Assuming the claim is true for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} S_{n+1} & = {\color{#3D99F6}S_n} + a_{n+1} \\ \frac {a_{n+1}^2 + 1}{2a_{n+1}} & = {\color{#3D99F6}\sqrt n} + a_{n+1} \\ a_{n+1}^2 + 1 & = 2\sqrt n a_{n+1} + 2 a_{n+1}^2 \\ a_{n+1}^2 + 2\sqrt n a_{n+1} & = 1 \\ a_{n+1}^2 + 2\sqrt n a_{n+1} + {\color{#3D99F6}n} & = {\color{#3D99F6}n} + 1 \\ \left(a_{n+1} + \sqrt n\right)^2 & = n + 1 \\ \implies a_{\color{#D61F06}n+1} & = \sqrt {\color{#D61F06}n+1} - \sqrt {{\color{#D61F06}n+1}-1} \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, the claim is true for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and hence true for all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n \ge 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\implies \dfrac 1{a_{2017}} = \dfrac 1{\sqrt{2017}-\sqrt{2016}} \approx \boxed{89.81091}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 16 Pairs Problem
